countryRankBandMessage1To28: Your country is among the most gender equal in the world. It ranks {{countryRank}}
countryRankBandMessage29To57: The gender gap in your country is relatively small compared with others. It ranks {{countryRank}}
countryRankBandMessage58To86: The gender gap in your country is about average compared with others. It ranks {{countryRank}}
countryRankBandMessage87To115: The gender gap in your country is relatively large compared with others. It ranks {{countryRank}}
countryRankBandMessage116To145: Your country is among the bottom ranking countries on gender equality. It ranks {{countryRank}}
risersText: In the past 10 years Bolivia and Nicaragua have risen the most
fallersText: Since 2005, Croatia and Sri Lanka have been among the biggest fallers
earningsDescrip: For every {{currencySymbol}}{{maleEarningsFigure}} a man earns, a woman earns {{currencySymbol}}{{femaleEarningsFigure}}
earningsFooter: Did you know that in the US, women on average work around two months for free each year compared with men?
graduatesTextWomen: Proportion of university graduates who are women
graduatesTextMen: Proportion of university graduates who are men
employmentDescrip: Proportion of women and men in, or looking for, work
employmentFooter: Did you know that out of 145 countries, the only four where more women than men are in work are in Africa? These are Malawi, Mozambique, Rwanda and Burundi.
seniorOfficialsWomenMessage0to10: Fewer than one in ten senior officials, managers and legislators are female.
seniorOfficialsWomenMessage11to15: Around one in ten senior officials, managers and legislators are female.
seniorOfficialsWomenMessage16to24: Around one in five senior officials, managers and legislators are female.
seniorOfficialsWomenMessage25to34: Around three in ten senior officials, managers and legislators are female.
seniorOfficialsWomenMessage35to44: Around two in five senior officials, managers and legislators are female.
seniorOfficialsWomenMessage45to50: Almost half the senior officials, managers and legislators are female.
seniorOfficialsWomenMessageAbove50: There are more female than male senior officials, managers and legislators.
seniorOfficialsMenMessageAbove95: Almost all senior officials, managers and legislators are male.
seniorOfficialsMenMessage85to94: Around nine in ten senior officials, managers and legislators are male.
seniorOfficialsMenMessage75to84: Around four in five senior officials, managers and legislators are male.
seniorOfficialsMenMessage65to74: Around seven in ten senior officials, managers and legislators are male.
seniorOfficialsMenMessage55to64: Around three in five senior officials, managers and legislators are male.
seniorOffiicialsMenMessage50to54: Around half of all senior officials, managers and legislators are male.
seniorOfficialsMenMessageBelow50: There are fewer male than female senior officials, managers and legislators.
seniorOfficialsFooter: Only in Colombia, Fiji and the Philippines do more women than men occupy these roles.
govMinistersDescripFemale: Share of government ministers that are women
govMinistersDescripMale: Share of government ministers that are men
globalSummaryDescrip: If the current rate of change continues, the economic gap between men and women will not close before
shareTextGlobalSummary: The economic gap between men and women is not set to close before 2133. Find out how your country ranks
emailSubject: How equal are you? Shared from BBC News
shareTextCountryRank: {{myCountry}} ranks {{countryRank}}/145 for gender equality. How about your country?
shareTextEarnings: For every {{currencySymbol}}{{maleEarningsFigure}} a man earns in {{myCountry}}, a woman earns {{currencySymbol}}{{femaleEarningsFigure}}. How about in your country?
shareTextGraduatesWomen: In {{myCountry}}, the proportion of female university graduates is {{graduatesPercentageWomen}}. What's the figure in your country?
shareTextGraduatesMen: In {{myCountry}}, the proportion of male university graduates is {{graduatesPercentageMen}}. What's the figure in your country?
shareTextEmploymentWomen: In {{myCountry}}, {{employmentPercentageWomen}} of women are in, or looking for, work. How about in your country?
shareTextEmploymentMen: In {{myCountry}}, {{employmentPercentageMen}} of men are in, or looking for, work. How about in your country?
shareTextSeniorOfficialsWomen: In {{myCountry}}, {{seniorOfficialsPercentageWomen}} of senior officials, managers and legislators are female. How about in your country?
shareTextSeniorOfficialsMen: In {{myCountry}}, {{seniorOfficialsPercentageMen}} of senior officials, managers and legislators are male. How about in your country?
shareTextGovernmentMinistersWomen: In {{myCountry}}, {{governmentMinistersPercentageWomen}} of government ministers are women. What's the figure in yours?
shareTextGovernmentMinistersMen: In {{myCountry}}, {{governmentMinistersPercentageMen}} of government ministers are men. What's the figure in yours?
